thread.title: Area highs school tournament draws for volleyball, soccer
thread.title_full: Area highs school tournament draws for volleyball, soccer

title: Area highs school tournament draws for volleyball, soccer
text: Area highs school tournament draws for volleyball, soccer Area highs school tournament draws for volleyball, soccer Comment Posted Oct. 13, 2015 at 12:59 AM Posted Oct. 13, 2015 at 12:59 AM The second season for area high school volleyball and soccer teams is on the horizon and the tournament drawings for both sports were held on Sunday. The results of those drawings are as follows: VOLLEYBALL In Division II, West Holmes claimed the No. 1 seed for the super sectional. The Knights will host the winner of the Oct. 19 6 p.m. contest between No. 22 Dover at No. 21 Buckeye Local on Oct. 22 at 6 p.m. No. 7 New Philadelphia will host either No. 11 Tri-Valley or No. 13 East Liverpool on Oct. 22 at 6 p.m. and No. 17 Indian Valley will entertain either No. 2 Philo or No. 14 Steubenville on Oct. 22 at 6 p.m. No. 8 Claymont will host No. 16 St. Clairsville Oct. 19 at 6 p.m. with the winner playing at No. 6 Maysville on Oct. 22 at 6 p.m. Finally, No. 9 River View will host No. 15 Carrollton on Oct. 19 with the winner playing at No. 4 Beaver Local on Oct. 22 at 6 p.m. In Division III, Tusky Valley claimed the No. 2 seed for the super sectional. The Trojans will host the winner between of the Oct. 20 6 p.m. contest between No. 12 Harrison Central at No. 10 West Muskingum on Oct. 24 at a time to be determined. No. 9 Garaway will travel to No. 4 Monroe Central Oct. 20 at 6 p.m. and will face either No. 5 Barnesville or No. 13 Bellaire Oct. 24 at a site and time to be determined. In an Inter-Valley Conference rematch, No. 3 Ridgewood will entertain No. 14 Newcomerstown Oct. 20 at 6 p.m. with the winner taking on either No. 6 Martins Ferry or No. 8 Edison Oct. 24 at a site and time to be determined. No. 7 Sandy Valley will host No. 11 Coshocton Oct. 20 with the winner facing top seed Buckeye Trail at Old Washington on Oct. 24 at a time to be determined. In Division IV, Tuscarawas Central Catholic captured the No. 2 seed in the super sectional. The Saints will host No. 14 Caldwell Oct. 21 at 6 p.m. with the winner facing No. 6 River or No. 11 Beallsville Oct. 24 at a site and time to de determined. No. 3 Malvern will entertain No. 10 Strasburg in an IVC rematch Oct. 21 with the winner facing No. 7 Bellaire St. John or No. 9 Frontier Oct. 24 at a site and time to be determined. No. 15 Hiland kicks off the tournament when it takes on host No. 13 Shadyside Oct. 19 at 6 p.m. with the winner traveling to No. 4 Steubenville Catholic Central on Oct. 21 at 6 p.m No. 17 Conotton Valley will travel to No. 6 River on Oct. 21 at 6 p.m. with the winner facing Steubenvile Catholic, Shadyside or Hiland Oct. 21 at 6 p.m. In the Northeast District Division II sectional, Fairless will open at Smithville vs. Triway Oct. 21 at 7:30 p.m. BOYS SOCCER Page 2 of 3 - In Northeast District Division I sectional, No. 7 seed Dover will travel to No. 6 GlenOak Oct. 21 at 7 p.m. The Tornadoes played in the Division II sectional last season in the East District. In the East Division II sectional, No. 7 River View will host Coshocton Country rival No. 11 Coshocton Oct. 20 at 6:30 p.m. with the winner facing either No. 12 East Liverpool or No. 15 Beaver Local on Oct. 24 at a site and time to be determined. No. 10 West Holmes will travel to No. 5 St. Clairsville on Oct. 20 at 6:30 p.m. with the winner taking on No. 4 Steubenville or No. 14 Cambridge on Oct. 24 at a site and time to be determined. No. 13 New Philadelphia journey to No. 8 Morgan Oct. 20 at either 4:30 or 6:30 p.m. with the winner facing either No. 1 Minerva, No. 12 Maysville or No. 17 Cambridge on Oct. 24 at a site and tie to be determined. No. 3 Hiland will host No. 8 Union Local Oct. 18 at 6:30 p.m. in the Division III sectional. The winner will face the winner of the Oct. 19 contest between No. 4 Tusky Valley and No. 6 Caldwell. The Trojans host the Indians with a X p.m. start. No. 5 Harrison Central will travel to No. 7 Edison Oct. 17 with the winner taking on host and top seed Zanensville Rosecrans Oct. 19 at a time to be determined. In the Northeast District Division III sectional, No. 9 Fairless will travel to No. 5 Smithville Oct. 20 at 7 p.m. to open the tournament. The winner will visit No. 4 Manchester Oct. 24 at 3 p.m. GIRLS SOCCER In the Division II super sectional, No. 3 West Holmes will host No. 17 East Liverpool Oct. 22 at 6 p.m. with the winner facing No. 3 Philo, No. 9 St. Clairsville or No. 10 Cambridge Oct. 24 at a site and time to be determined. No. 14 Carrollton will travel to No. 1 Beaver Local Oct. 2 at 6 p.m with the winner taking on No. 5 Minerva or No. 15 Morgan Oct. 24 at a site and time to be determined. No. 4 River View will entertain either No. 11 Steubenville or No. 12 Dover Oct. 21 at 6 p.m. The Tornadoes travel to Big Red Oct 19 at 6 p.m. to open the tournament. No. 7 New Philadelphia will host No. 13 Maysville Oct. 21 at 6 p.m. with the winner taking on No. 18 Ridgewood or No. 2 Joh Glenn Oct. 24 at a site and time to be determined. The Generals host the Little Muskies Oct. 21 at 6 p.m. In Division III, No. 2 Coshocton will host No. 5 Edison Oct. 22 at 6:30 p.m. with the winner taking on No. 3 Hiland or No. 4 Steubenville Catholic Central Oct. 28 at a site and time to be determined. The Hawks will host the Crusaders Oct. 22 at 6:30 p.m. No. 6 Harrison Central will play either No. 1 Rosecrans or No. 7 West Muskingum on Oct. 28 at a site and time to be determined. Page 3 of 3 - In the Northeast District Division II sectional, No. 8 Fairless travels to No. 7 Marlington Oct. 19 at the 7 p.m. to open its tournament play. The winner will play at No. 5 Norton Oct. 22 at 7 p.m. Times Reporter
